author: Staff Reporter
text:
A two-day national conference on the iconography of Hindus, Buddhists and Jains will be organised at C.P. Ramaswami Aiyar Institute of Indological Research on Eldams Road in Alwarpet from Friday as part of the golden jubilee celebrations of the Institute.

Speaking to reporters on Monday, Professor Nanditha Krishna, director of the Institute, said the conference acquires significance in the light of the current interest in viewing Indian cultural heritage through a new perspective.

Will bridge the gap

The conference will bridge the gap in the evaluation of the representations of the icons belonging to the three major religions, she said.

The country was host to rich religious, artistic and societal traditions.

Each region in the country has developed its unique and distinctive style of iconography. Each dynasty and period has also contributed to the development and art style.

“The conference is named after R.S. Gupte’s book Iconography of the Hindu, Buddhist and Jains , which codified and simplified Indian iconography,” Ms. Krishna said.

G.J. Sudhakar, head, Historial Studies at the Institute, said more than 200 participants including archaeological students and research scholars are expected to attend the two-day event.
